results.title: Proof (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Winner of 7 Australian Film Institute awards, “Proof” is a provocative and engrossing film about a man’s obsessive search for truth. Martin (Hugo Weaving) has been blind from birth. He trusts no-one, except for the camera which has replaced his eyes. His photos are proof that the world he senses is the same as other people see. Then he meets a young kitchen hand, Andy, whose honesty and kindness allow Martin to trust for the first time - until Martin’s jealous housekeeper, Celia, sets out to destroy this relationship. Written and directed by Jocelyn Moorhouse who won a 1992 Victorian Premier’s Literary Award for her screenplay.

results.title: Promises, promises: small town survival
results.creator_credit: Reevan Dolgoy, Roger Hart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film exploring the problems and potential’s of small towns in the Drumheller Valley region of Alberta. It documents the citizen participation generated in the region by the Task Force on Urbanisation and the Future, the citizens’ reaction to curtailment of the Task Force exercise, the events that followed, and the lesson of this experience for other districts facing similar problems.

results.title: Prologue
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A story focusing on the youth-rebellion movement of 1968, revolving around Jesse (John Robb) a young Montrealer who edits an underground newspaper. He and his female companion are joined by David (Gary Rader) a young draft dodger from the United States. In the choices they make, the two rival philosophies of dissenting youth become evident: militant protest or communal retreat. The film includes some of the bloody rioting in Chicago during the 1968 Democratic Convention. Also seen and heard in the film is anti-war and civil rights spokesman Abbie Hoffman. Other members of the Intellectual Left making brief appearances in Prologue include Allen Ginsberg, Jean Genet, John Kenneth Galbraith, and William S. Burroughs. Cast includes: Elaine Malus, Christopher Cordeaux, Peter Cullen, Frank Edwards, Henry Gamer, Robert Girolami and Victor Knight. Script, Sherwood Forest. Editing, Christopher Cordeaux. Music, Bill Brooks, Michael Malus and The Ventures. (Awards: London, Toronto, Colombo)

results.title: Projection Privee = Private Projection
results.brief_description:
Denis, a young director who is still traumatised by the violent death of his young lover, decides to make a film with about this tragic episode. One of the highlights of this film is the insight it gives into the actual mechanics of filmmaking.

Credits: Director, Francois Leterrier ; writer, Francois Leterrier, Madeleine Chapsal, Bernard Revon ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Serge Gainsbourg, Jean-Claude Vannier.
Cast: Francoise Fabian, Jean-Luc Bideau, Jane Birkin, Bulle Ogier, Jacques Weber.

results.title: Restoration
results.creator_credit: Christine Hansen, Kate Riedl, Cordelia Beresford and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
On a remote New South Wales property in 1912, the image was captured of a young woman who worked as a maid. Her calm gaze hid passions that emerged to subvert her fate. In Restoration fragments of memory combine in photography and dance to retell her story.
Narelle Benjamin (the maid) and Solon Ulbrich (the photographer) also choreographed the dance sequences.

results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: Luke Dunn Gielmuda, Aaron Rogers and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“Sometime in the early 50S the Soviet Space Agency launched Project Vlad. Details are sketchy, but it was a top secret mission. Shrouded in secrecy, few records were kept and the Project has since been all but forgotten…”
Vlad is a Russian chimpanzee cosmonaut. Sent into orbit as a prelude to manned space flight, his hopes for heroism have long since faded. Vlad is a victim of Cold War politics; a long forgotten anachronism whose fate is to trace an endless and lonely trajectory around the Earth.
Project Vlad was created digitally on a Silicon Graphics O2/Infinite Reality Engine using Maya 1.5 and Flame 5.5 software. It was then transferred to 35mm film using a Solitair Film Recorder.

results.title: Bound
results.creator_credit: Daniella Ortega, Serhat Caradee and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A boy, a dead body, a relentless pursuit – it’s not what you see, it’s how you see it.
Bound is an urban tragedy about a boy who is mistakenly shot by the police. Jumping back and forth in time to reveal instincts colliding and lives unravelling in a world that rushes on regardless, this film is about what happens when you make all the wrong decisions for the right reasons.
